abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Series of Five Poverty
            Reduction Support Credits (PRSC) Project for Vietnam were as
            follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory, risk to
            development outcome was moderate, Bank performance was
            satisfactory, and Borrower performance was moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: the breadth of
            the reform undertaking and linkages among policy actions
            across sectors called for a comprehensive approach to
            dialogue and support by development partners. The strong
            track record of government commitment and adoption by
            partners of the PRSC series to match government priorities
            and processes made this approach work. Analytical work gives
            insight on inter-linkages across individual policy areas, as
            well as cross-cutting issues, and helps ensure they are
            appropriately taken into account in the reforms supported
            under the operation. Dedicated and adequate resources for
            analytical work and short-term technical assistance enables
            the government and development partners to assess the
            potential impacts of related policy actions and help refine
            the proposals. Donor coordination can strengthen the policy
            dialogue and deliver benefits to the client. The PRSC series
            served as an effective framework for policy dialogue and
            interactions between the government and donors. Government
            line ministries voiced concern that financial flows from the
            PRSCs went directly into the state budget, and their
            participation in the often time-intensive policy dialogue
            did not result in direct budgetary increases. Multi-sectoral
            Development Policy Lendings (DPLs) may be best suited to
            ministries that have clear and strong policy linkages, and
            where improved policy coordination is a primary objective.
            There is a need to complement consideration of outcome
            indicators by looking at qualitative assessments of
            achievements and also at complementary objectives.
